title: Erdős space
summary: In mathematics, Erdős space is a topological space named after Paul Erdős, who described it in 1940.[1] Erdős space is defined as a subspace E ⊂ ℓ 2 {\displaystyle E\subset \ell ^{2}} of the Hilbert space of square summable sequences, consisting of the sequences whose elements are all rational numbers.
